intro: Pyrethrum kermanense, commonly known as Kerman pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to the Kerman region of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant produces fine, hair-like structures called trichomes, which contain pyrethrins—natural insecticides. These compounds make it valuable in organic pest control. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun for optimal growth.
